column10: Description (w/ notes)

column4: Work Breakdown Structure             (BDS Programs - if no C4 control account assigned to task)
column6: Either matches WBS in Cobra or is at a lower level
column10:
Work Breakdown Structure Code. Punctuated Significant or Fixed Format in OPP.  

Note:  Field is not populated automatically.  During OPP/Cobra mapping, the Cobra assigned WBS is populated in the C_USERCHR01 field of the Control Account code value. 

BDS Programs w/DFAR using Acumen and/or JSON must use this code field, otherwise:
BDS Programs, refer to IPSG-9000-007 WBS, OBS, and CAM Fields for guidance on usage

column4: Organizational Breakdown Structure                                                  (BDS Programs - if no C4 control account assigned to task)
column6: Either matches OBS in Cobra or is at a lower level
column8: Wing IPT Manager, Fuselage AIT Manager, A00, AA0
column10:
Responsibility Breakdown Structure. Structure which breaks down responsibility from Program Manager to Assembly & Integration Teams (AIT's) and/or Integrated Product Teams (IPT's) down to Responsible Control/Cost Account Managers (CAM's).   

Note:  Field is not populated automatically.  During OPP/Cobra mapping, the Cobra assigned OBS is populated in the C_USERCHR02 field of the Control Account code value.

BDS Programs w/DFAR using Acumen and/or JSON must use this code field, otherwise:
BDS Programs, refer to IPSG-9000-007 WBS, OBS, and CAM Fields for guidance on usage

Used to identify which type of Quantifiable Assess Percent Complete (QA%C) the activity is using.  When the backup data will be defined directly in OPP, otherwise leave blank.
Programs refer to:  IPSG-9000-019 Quantifiable Backup Data

column6: Matches Control Accounts, flagged for OPP, in Cobra
column10:
Unique Identifier within a Cobra Reporting Master, which identifies a control account. A control account is assigned to an intersection of a WBS and OBS and is the lowest level in Cobra where Budget (BCWS), Earned Value (BCWP) and Actuals (ACWP) are integrated.  Required for Cost/Schedule Integration.

During OPP/Cobra mapping, the WBS, OBS, CAM, Planner information assigned in Cobra is automatically populated in the Code Value User Defined Fields of C_USERCHR01, C_USERCHR02, C_CAM, C_PLANNER.  This table should only ever be populated using the OPP/Cobra mapping, manual inputs can cause integration problems later.  
Refer to:  IPSG-9000-007 WBS, OBS, and CAM Fields.

Index # and description of Integrated Master Plan/Integrated Master Schedule item. Typically a punctuated significant code but could be fixed format.

Programs with an IMP requirement, refer to:  IPSG-9000-012 IMS Content Requirements
Cost Class used to document and control baseline changes and approvals.  Mandatory for CD processing  & Change Control.
Used to assign the planners name to the work package.  The description should contain the planner's name (last, first, MI recommended).

column8:
CAM Vis format: Historical:  Last_First>BEMS
NOW:  Last_First_BEMS
column10:
Used to assign a Status Focal (CAM or Delegate) to an activity to allow statusing by a Status Focal in CAM Vis.  The description should contain the status focal's name (last, first, MI recommended)

Note:  Field is not populated automatically.  During OPP/Cobra mapping, the Cobra assigned CAM is populated in the C_CAM field of the Control Account code value.  

BDS Programs refer to:  IPSG-9000-007 'WBS, OBS, and CAM Fields' and IPSG-9000-012 'IMS Content Requirements' for guidance on usage

Used to assign the schedulers name to the work package. The code description should be the scheduler's BEMS ID.

Programs refer to:  IPSG-9000-003 Integrated Scheduler Code Field
An alternate breakdown structure to segregate work within an IPT

Index # and description of Program Statement of Work Paragraph. Typically a punctuated significant code but could be fixed format.

Programs refer to:  IPSG-9000-012 IMS Content Requirements, DID, IPMR and IPMDAR
Identifies Line Item Code in Contract which provides contractual funding for task being performed.
Identifier for hardware or software configuration end item such as Aircraft model code
Identifies Code corresponding to Contract Data Requirement List for activity being performed.

Identifies type of material utilized on longest lead, most complex part on a particular drawing. Used in conjunction with part type, size & complexity code to identify applicable standard tasks and duration times for drawing/build to activities.  Required for MES Interface.

Identifies type of mfg process utilized on longest lead, most complex part on a particular drawing. Used in conjunction with material type, size & complexity code to identify applicable standard tasks and duration times for drawing/build to activities.  Required for MES Interface.

Fields Size and Complexity have been combined to produce a two character code which has (sample) values of Small/Medium/Large for first position, Simple .. Extremely Complex 1-4. Code example represents Simple (size) that is Complex. Used in conjunction with material type & part type to identify applicable standard tasks and duration times for drawing/build to activities.  Required for MES Interface.

column4: Work Definition Document Type of Change/Key Deliverables
column8: DCN, EO, New, AV, TST, Fab
column10: Code which identifies type of change. This code determines standard template durations for Change Coordination & Release activities.  Required for MES Interface.  Is also used in ReMICS.

Used to categorize & identify major kinds of IPT Documents such as Production Drawings, Schematics, Mock-Up Drawings, Ground test Drawings, Flight Test Drawings, Procurement Specs, etc. Facilitates the filtering and sorting of IPT documents for reporting and metrics.

Make/Buy code field to identify whether the part is to be made ('M') or purchased ('B').

Mandatory by Process if Project is Associated with MES
Identifier assigned by T&E to specific test activities. Facilitates filtering and sorting of specific sequences of test activates for reporting and metrics.
Identifies unique code of Ground Test Article for 1st applicable Test Effectivity of particular non-recurring activity.

Used to identify Billing Events, and schedule replans. Combined with Graphic Summarization Type and Tiered code files, flags how activity should be depicted graphically when shown on summary bars/symbols.  Will be also used with ReMICS to show Scheduling Metrics and Important Milestones
This field allows a user, with an appropriate template, to "force" the milestone symbol, milestone description, and milestone date (text) to appear at various locations above/below a task bar.
Identifies the activity to be copied into the Month End OPP Project using the Month-End Closing tool.
Flags criticality of activity from a overall program perspective (cost/sched/tech/risk).  Goes to ReMICS.
Informs the user as to status of the Virtual Task after it has been added or updated.

column4: Tiering capable 60/90 Day and Criticality Flag
column10: Identifies activity to be included within a Scheduling Metrics count and the definition of the count.
Reference of the (single primary) person responsible for performing and completing this task/milestone. The code values should be the Standard ID and the description contain the name.

column8: NGC, BAE, CUST, EXT, UA, MARGIN, MISC
column10:
Indentifies the organization that has responsibility for the task.  (either supplier, customer, Boeing (optional), production, unauthorized task, schedule margin, etc.)

BDS Programs refer to IPSG-9000-002 Allowable Non-Resource Loaded IMS Activity Types and IPSG-9000-008 Integrated Scheduling Requirements Tailoring Matriz

Used to identify the Risk # (from Risk Registry ID, BORIS ID, etc.) for the Mitigation Plan Steps included in the IMS.
Programs ref to:  IPSG-9000-012 IMS Content Requirements.

Organizational Impact identifies the impact to other organizations.

BDS Programs - if contractual IMS CDRL and / or DFAR clause requirements, can not use to identify Hand-offs or SVTs (see IPSG-9000-006 and IPSG-9000-002)
Indicates that the cost class scheduler has analyzed the proposed baseline date changes and has determined that the dates will work in the schedule.

Numeric code assigned to each unit time assembly or major assembly position for release of MLP job paper, parts pick manifest and cost accumulation
Required if Project is Associated with IGOLD

Flags activities that are to be zeroed out and removed from Cobra and OPP
Mandatory for CD processing & Change Control.
Used to identify functionality area to perform the task.

Unique Identifier for a given aircraft.
Required if Project is Associated with IGOLD

Identifies recurring and non recurring activities for Estimate to Budget Baseline (EtBB) Best Practice
Required if Project is Associated with EtBB

Identifies activity costs measured either in hours or dollars for Estimate to Budget Baseline (EtBB) Best Practive
Required if Project is Associated with EtBB

Identifies activies by Change Document number that will be integrated with Cobra using the Integration Wizard
Required if Project is Level 3 Change Control (identified in Cobra)

column8:
Critical

(Only 'Critical' should be used.  All others are no longer applicable and should not be selected)
column10:
Identifies Critical material represented in the IMS as 'Critical' (required).  
Programs refer to:  IPSG-4711-003 'IMS Material Integration'
The field allows users to assign a schedule risk code to an activity that is used by Risk Ranger to calculate the duration input values used in the schedule risk analysis process.
CAM Visibility users will have to select a Reason code from the C43 code file when they input an Actual Start date which is later than the Baseline Start date.

column7: BDS IP&S Home Office Tools Team / BCA Core
column10:
This field allows users to identify Gate Closure Decision Milestone.  A pre set of milestones are provided for use.  
Refer to BDS IPSG-9000-009 for more details.
This field is used for reporting. It contains a short description (20-30 characters) of the contract/delivery order/ECP.  The complete description can be included in the Code Description.
Identifies closed WPs impacted by a SPA implemented on the program.  These WPs end up disconnected with Cobra & further action may be needed

column8: i.e. Drawings, Procurement, Sub-Assembly, Qual Testing, etc.

Code C47 is Specific to the Commitment Scheduling Team, and their reporting requirement.  
BDS Programs - refer to IPSG-9000-024 CSCC OPP INTSCH C47 Code Field.
CAM Visibility users will have to select a Reason code from the C48 code file when they input an Actual Finish date and the actual duration of the task is greater than the baselined duration.
